edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Node
Direct Known Subclasses:
RIONode
public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object

Node -- Class defining the interface and basic functionality of a node. The student should extend this class to provide additional functionality. This code must be written as a state machine -- each upcall must do its work and return so that other upcalls can be delivered

Node

Method Detail

getFailureRate

public static double getFailureRate()
Failure rate functions that designate probability of an event happening. The student may hide these by implementing static methods with the same signature in their own node class. 0<=p<=1.

getRecoveryRate

public static double getRecoveryRate()

getDropRate

public static double getDropRate()

getDelayRate

public static double getDelayRate()

init

final void init(Manager manager,
                int addr)
Called by the manager to initialize certain variables. Students should not worry about this method. We do this here, rather than in the constructor in order to avoid passing a manager to the student's implementation

Parameters:
manager - The manager for the current simulation/emulation
addr - Address of the new node

start

public abstract void start()
Called by the manager to start this node up.

fail

public void fail()
Stop the node and don't return. Please make sure to call this at the end of any overriding fail. Overriding this method should only be used for logging purposes, since you are not guaranteed that it will be called for each crash (especially in an emulation)

onReceive

public abstract void onReceive(java.lang.Integer from,
                               int protocol,
                               byte[] msg)
Called by the manager when a packet has arrived for this node

Parameters:
from - The address of the node that has sent this message
protocol - The protocol identifier of the message
msg - The serialized version of the message

onCommand

public abstract void onCommand(java.lang.String command)
Called by the manager when there is a command for this node from the user or a file.

Parameters:
command - The command for this node

send

public void send(int destAddr,
                 int protocol,
                 byte[] payload)
This method should be the one called to send a message.

Parameters:
destAddr - The address of the destination
pkt - The serialized form of the packet

broadcast

public void broadcast(int protocol,
                      byte[] payload)
This method should be the one called to broadcast a message to all nodes in the network.

Parameters:
destAddr - The address of the destination
pkt - The serialized form of the packet

addTimeout

public void addTimeout(Callback cb,
                       int timer)
Adds a timer interrupt for the current node. If timeout is 0, it just invokes the method

Parameters:
cb - The callback object that should be invoked when the interrupt fires

getReader

public PersistentStorageReader getReader(java.lang.String filename)
                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Gets a PersistentStorageReader object for the filename specified.

Parameters:
filename - The file to open for reading
Returns:
A PersistentStorageReader that can read the filename
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist or can't be opened for reading

getWriter

public PersistentStorageWriter getWriter(java.lang.String filename,
                                         boolean append)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Gets a persistentStorageWriter object for the filename specified

Parameters:
filename - The file to open for writing
append - Whether to append to the end of the file, or start at the beginning
Returns:
A PersistentStorageWriter that can write to the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be opened for writing

checkWriteCrash

void checkWriteCrash(java.lang.String description)
Called before any modification of persistent storage. Tells the manager to check whether we should crash or not.

Parameters:
description - Helpful description of the operation that is being attempted. This is mostly to aid in debugging and user-specified crashes.

toSynopticString

public final java.lang.String toSynopticString()
Returns a unique string identifier for this node that can be used in synoptic log files.

Returns:
unique string identifying this node
